feature1.explanation: Both texts use hyphens, colons, and parentheses, but only the first text includes commas and quotation marks.

feature2.explanation: Both texts display a mix of formal and informal lexical choices, with some variation in word choice. Both texts also exhibit grammatical errors.

feature3.explanation: Both texts contain sentences of varying lengths and complexity. The first text appears more structured and cohesive, while the second text seems less organized.

feature4.explanation: Both texts have a critical tone and make references to specific media outlets and personalities. The first text criticizes the new owner of CNN, while the second text criticizes the new head of CNN.

feature5.explanation: Both texts are relatively error-free in terms of spelling and typographical errors.

overall.explanation: Considering the commonalities and distinctions in the linguistic features analyzed, there is moderate confidence that the two texts were written by the same author.
